rComments: God, his penmanship is awful. You wouldn't be able tell the difference between a small intestine and a kidney if he drew them next to each other. That being said, his tests are not very challenging and the final is not cumulative. Just try to make sense out of his scribbles and memorize diagrams in the book and you'll be fine.

Manel is very knowledgable about all things anatomy so get to know him if you a remote interest in any of the topics that he brings up in class. Yet he is a horrible lecturer, misspells many terms, and has the worst organization of notes I've ever seen. He tries to improve however. Def not a born lecturer. Read the book and speed through podcasts.

Great guy, difficult class. It's interesting that he spends ZERO effort to project his voice. He basically whispers the material and expects the mic to do its job. It is also very tough to decode his handwriting. Print out a list of vocabs before class will be helpful.

Prof Camps is a really nice caring professor.He tries really tries to be clear and help students in every way.He posts lectures slides w/anatomical pictures and outlines. You basically need to know every thing on the outlines and slides. It's anatomy... It's obviously going to be a hard class. You must study a lot. Class is curved a 85-100, B 75-85

passionate guy who really knows his stuf, made difficult material very approachable and as stress-free as he could i didnt find his accent to get in way at all very tough class but manuel made it manageable by making effort to not to stress us out. exams are difficult so study harder and a little differently than you usually do for other bio class
Very nice teacher.  Has a really thick accent that is hard to understand.  Wanted to be able to enjoy the class because I was genuinely interested in the topic, but he made it so unbearably boring.

It is a very vigorous class that requires so much comprehension and memorization. Just know everything (especially with charts on the notes) because the professor can test students on anything. If you want to really pass the class, the you should read the book, go to a tutor/section/MSI, and listen to the podcast frequently. So much time + energy..

Class also Anth107. Manel is a good prof - he clearly knows the information and he does his best to keep you engaged. The problem is his accent. I'd recommend going to lecture, then using the info he gives you as a baseline for what to read in the book. Use lecture podcasts if they're available, and study at your own pace.
